title: Coshocton takes down Claymont
text:
2 CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Coshocton 42 Claymont 14 
Behind two touchdowns a piece by Spencer McCrea, Jake Fortney and Zach Michael the Redskins took down the Mustangs convincingly. 
But with a 21-7 lead at halftime, coach Jim Woodrum said the team wasn’t playing how they were capable. 
“We were making a lot of mental mistakes. They were playing hard, but they were just making some mistakes that they normally wouldn’t make,” Woodrum said. “We talked and I challenged them a little bit and they really came on and played a good second half.” 
The Redskins scored three straight touchdowns in the third quarter finishing the 12-minute period with a 42-7 lead. 
This win makes next week’s game against River View even more important. If Coshocton takes down the Black Bears they will win the ECOL Grey Division title. 
“That’s huge because we want to send these seniors off with a win,” Woodrum said. “It’s also a county rival and you never want to lose to a county rival. If you do it stays with you for 365 days. With a win it will help us achieve a goal of ours also.” Read or Share this story: http://ohne.ws/1LTsEvx TOP VIDEOS
